document.docAuthor: Aswathy, Mathilakath Dasan & Sudhikumar, Ambalaparambil Vasu
document.docTitle: Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus Aswathy & Sudhikumar 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the millipede genus Propyrgodesmus Silvestri, 1920, with the description of a new species from a sacred grove in Kerala, India (Diplopoda: Polydesmida Pyrgodesmidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the millipede genus Propyrgodesmus Silvestri, 1920, with the description of a new species from a sacred grove in Kerala, India (Diplopoda: Polydesmida Pyrgodesmidae)

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 1. Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus sp. nov., habitus. A, C. Holotype ♂ (CATE-5503A), dorsal and ventral views, respectively. B. Female paratype (CATE-5503C), dorsal view. Scale bar: 1 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 2. Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus sp. nov., paratype ♂ (CATE-5503B). A, B. Anterior part of body, ventral and dorsal views, respectively. C. Right antenna, anterior view. D–F. Posterior part of body, ventral, dorsal and lateral views, respectively. G. Right midbody leg, anterior view. Scale bars: 0.5 mm (A, B, E), 0.4 mm (D), 0.2 mm (C), 0.1 mm (F, G).
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 3. Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus sp. nov., paratype ♂ (CATE-5503B). A. Left gonopod, posterior view. B. Right gonopod, anterior view. C, D. Both gonopods, posterior and anterior views, respectively. Abbreviations: b: medial branch; cx: coxite; h: hook like structure of telopodite; sph: solenophore; sl: solenomere. Scale bar: 0.2 mm (for C and D). A, B not to scale.
figureCitation.captionText-3: FIGURE 4. Propyrgodesmus spp. A–C. Propyrgodesmus lobulatus Silvestri, 1920, holotype ♀ after Silvestri (1920). A, B. Anterior and posterior parts of the body, dorsal and lateral views, respectively. C. Right antenna, anterior view. D–F. Propyrgodesmus frater Carl, 1932 syntype ♂, after Carl (1932). D, E. Gonopods, anterior and posterior views, respectively. F. Antenna. G. Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus sp. nov., holotype ♂ (CATE-5503A), right antenna, anterior view. Not to scale.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype
♂ (CATE-5503A), Sacred groves of Kottayil Siva Kshethram , Muchukunnu , Ko- zhikode district, Kerala , India 11°29’42’’N , 75°39’55’’E ,
9 m a.s.l.
, collected from rotting wood, hand collection,
08.10.2021
, M.D. Aswathy leg.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes :
1 ♂ (CATE-5503B), 2 ♀♀ (CATE-5503C, D),
3 ♀♀ juveniles (CATE-5503E, F, G), same locality, hand-collected together with holotype , but from top soil
.
Name. To emphasize the bulbous appearance of the medial branch of the gonopodal telopodite.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus
sp. nov.
, habitus. A, C. Holotype ♂ (CATE-5503A), dorsal and ventral views, respectively. B. Female paratype (CATE-5503C), dorsal view. Scale bar: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. When comparing to
P. lobulatus ,
the new species shows major differences in the tergal ornamentation by having most paraterga only vaguely trilobulate laterally ( Fig. 2B, E ), vs clearly trilobate ( Fig. 4A, B ) and by the presence of a ventral cone on antennomere 4 bearing a long sensillum trichodeum ( Figs 2C , 4G ), vs a ventral cone on antennomere 4 absent ( Fig. 4C ). On the contrary, the new species shows some similarities to the tergal ornamentation of
P. frater
, but differs significantly in the biramous gonopod with a bulbous lateral branch of the telopodite ( Fig. 3A, B ) vs with prong—and lobe-like structures on the main branch of the telopodite ( Fig. 4D, E ). A key to all three existing species of the genus is given below.

Description . Holotype ca 7.6 mm long, width of mid-body pro—and metazonae 0.78 and 1.5 mm , respectively. Male paratype ca 7.5 mm , width of pro—and metazonae 0.78 and 1.5 mm , respectively. Adult female paratypes ca 7.5 and 9 mm long, width of pro—and metazonae 0.76–0.85 and 1.5–1.6 mm , respectively. Live colouration dark brown, dorsum encrusted with soil particles; antennae, legs and venter pale whitish ( Fig. 1A, B ). Both vertex and frons light brown, clypeolabrum whitish ( Fig. 2A ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus
sp. nov.
, paratype ♂ (CATE-5503B). A, B. Anterior part of body, ventral and dorsal views, respectively. C. Right antenna, anterior view. D–F. Posterior part of body, ventral, dorsal and lateral views, respectively. G. Right midbody leg, anterior view. Scale bars: 0.5 mm ( A, B, E ), 0.4 mm ( D) , 0.2 mm ( C) , 0.1 mm ( F , G ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Body broad due to large paraterga ( Fig. 1A ), with 20 body rings in both sexes ( Fig. 1A, B ). In width, head << collum ≤ 2 <3–16, body tapering thereafter towards telson ( Fig. 1A–C ). Head ovoid, slightly transverse and sparsely setose in clypeolabral region, granulate above antennal sockets either side of epicranial suture. Genae subquadrate and granulate. Interantennal isthmus twice as wide as diameter of antennal socket. Antenna short, weakly clavate, reaching up to body ring 3 when stretched ventrolaterally. In length, antennomere 7<6<1<3<4<2<<5 ( Figs. 2A, C , 4G ). Dense and sharply delimited fields of sensilla basiconica located distodorsaly on antennomeres 5 and 6. Sensory field of 5 th antennomere not extending up to base of long sensillum trichodeum.Antennomere 4 with ventral sensillum trichodeum borne on a small, but evident cone/hump ( Figs 2C , 4G ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3 .
Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus
sp. nov.
, paratype ♂ (CATE-5503B). A. Left gonopod, posterior view. B. Right gonopod, anterior view. C, D. Both gonopods, posterior and anterior views, respectively. Abbreviations: b: medial branch; cx: coxite; h : hook like structure of telopodite; sph: solenophore; sl: solenomere. Scale bar: 0.2 mm (for C and D ). A, B not to scale.

FIGURE 4.
Propyrgodesmus spp. A
–C.
Propyrgodesmus lobulatus Silvestri, 1920
, holotype ♀ after Silvestri (1920) . A, B. Anterior and posterior parts of the body, dorsal and lateral views, respectively. C. Right antenna, anterior view. D–F.
Propyrgodesmus frater Carl, 1932
syntype ♂, after Carl (1932) . D, E. Gonopods, anterior and posterior views, respectively. F. Antenna. G.
Propyrgodesmus bulbogonopus
sp. nov.
, holotype ♂ (CATE-5503A), right antenna, anterior view. Not to scale.

FIGURE 5. Distribution of the genus
Propyrgodesmus Silvestri, 1920
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The following key can be proposed to separate the known species of
Propyrgodesmus
:

paragraph.keyLead: 1 Sensillum trichodeum of the 4 th antennomere borne on a hump................................................. 2

- Sensillum trichodeum of the 4 th antennomere not on a hump...........................................
P. lobulatus

2 Gonopod telopodite with a laterally directed prong-like structure..........................................
P. frater

- Gonopod telopodite with prominent bulb-like medial branch...............................
P. bulbogonopus
sp. nov .
